definition: to fill the road (also fig. clamor, cries of complaint)/to communicate a moral/to convey the Way/to express (idea, preference, complaint)
to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced
words of truth/moral expressed in words/written article explaining a moral
lit. praise fills the roads (idiom); praise everywhere/universal approbation
starved corpses fill the roads (idiom); state of famine
lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced
lamentations fill the roads (idiom); severe suffering all around
lit. praise fills the roads (idiom); praise everywhere/universal approbation
starved corpses fill the roads (idiom); state of famine

sentences.chinese: 漁民因此頭昏目眩而怨聲載道。

sentences.english: Internet chat rooms are packed with frustrated CFA candidates.
sentences.chinese: CFA考生在互聯網聊天室裏怨聲載道。

sentences.english: What Written Zen of Song Dynasty emphasizes just is such a kind of possibility.
sentences.chinese: 文字禪所強調的“文以載道”，即是謂此。

sentences.english: Every other country complains about your bank-secrecy laws.
sentences.chinese: 《銀行保密法》是衆矢之的，其他國家全都怨聲載道。

sentences.english: You can hear the hollering on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 你可以聽到交易廳中怨聲載道。

sentences.english: The citizens complained to heaven about the tax burden.
sentences.chinese: 公民對苛捐雜稅怨聲載道。

sentences.english: Local residents often complain about noise and crime associated with the bases.
sentences.chinese: 駐軍噪音擾民甚至從事犯罪活動，當地居民怨聲載道。
